adjectives.description: inglobate (comparative more inglobate, superlative most inglobate)

entries.meaning: In the form of a globe or sphere; applied to nebulous matter collected into a sphere by the force of gravitation.

verbs.description: inglobate (third-person singular simple present inglobates, present participle inglobating, simple past and past participle inglobated)

entries.meaning: To incorporate something into a larger globular thing
examples: The scar of the obstructed bronchiole is inglobated in the wall of the free bronchiole.
